name: Drug Overdose Death
title: Drug Overdose Death

api_list.name: /ageNum
api_list.description: The 'ageNum' endpoint in the 'DrugOverdoseDeath' API provides an array of strings that represents different age categories relating to drug overdose deaths. This endpoint gives users the option to explore the possible values for the 'ageNum' field, which is used to classify the age range of individuals affected by drug overdose.The values returned in the array may include age categories such as '10-14', '25-34', '45-54', and so on. These categories help identify the specific age groups that are most vulnerable to drug overdose. By accessing this endpoint, users can gather insights into the distribution of drug-related deaths across different age ranges.This information can be crucial for various purposes, such as studying trends in drug overdose fatalities among different age groups, identifying high-risk populations, or developing targeted prevention strategies. The 'ageNum' endpoint provides a comprehensive view of the possible age categories associated with drug overdose deaths, enabling researchers, policymakers, and healthcare professionals to analyze and address this critical issue effectively.

api_list.name: /year
api_list.description: The endpoint 'year' from the API 'DrugOverdoseDeath' provides a user-friendly way to retrieve all possible values for the field 'year'. This endpoint returns an array of strings, each representing a specific year for which drug overdose death data is available. By using this endpoint, you can easily access a comprehensive list of years included in the dataset. Whether you need to analyze drug overdose trends over time or gather statistical information for a particular year, this endpoint simplifies the process by providing an organized collection of all available years. The values returned by this endpoint typically range from the early 2000s to the present, allowing you to explore a wide range of years and gain insights into the evolving nature of drug-related fatalities.

api_list.name: /yearNum
api_list.description: The 'yearNum' endpoint in the 'DrugOverdoseDeath' API returns an array of strings that represent the possible values for the field 'yearNum'. This field indicates the specific year associated with drug overdose deaths. By accessing this endpoint, you can retrieve a list of unique years for which data on drug overdose deaths is available. These values are presented in the form of strings, allowing easy identification and utilization in your applications or analysis.For example, if you query the 'yearNum' endpoint, you may receive a list that includes strings like '2010', '2013', '2017', and so on. This information provides insights into the timeframe covered by the dataset, allowing you to examine trends, patterns, or compare different years' data related to drug overdose deaths.To summarize, the 'yearNum' endpoint offers an array of strings presenting the available years related to drug overdose deaths, enabling you to understand and analyze the data based on different timeframes.

api_list.name: /records
api_list.description: The 'records' endpoint is the heart of the DrugOverdoseDeath API, ensuring easy access to vital information on drug overdose deaths. By making use of query parameters, this endpoint retrieves a collection of objects that precisely align with your specific needs and interests. The returned array of objects comprises individual rows, each representing a distinct occurrence of a drug overdose death.Through this endpoint, users can explore and retrieve important insights related to drug overdose death incidents. You can customize your search by utilizing various query parameters such as date range, location, specific drugs involved, demographics, and other relevant factors. This flexibility allows you to delve deeper into the data and gain a comprehensive understanding of the drug overdose landscape.The provided records empower users to study patterns, trends, and geographical variations in drug overdose deaths. With these valuable insights, researchers, policymakers, healthcare professionals, and concerned individuals can make informed decisions, develop effective interventions, and raise awareness about this critical public health issue. The 'records' endpoint serves as a gateway to a wealth of information, helping to drive positive change and save lives.

api_list.name: /stubName
api_list.description: The 'stubName' endpoint in the 'DrugOverdoseDeath' API provides a convenient way to access a range of string values related to categories or descriptors used in the dataset. By making a request to this endpoint, you can retrieve an array of possible values for the 'stubName' field. Think of 'stubName' as a broad term that represents different aspects or characteristics of drug overdose deaths. For example, one possible value could be 'Sex and age', which may provide insights into the correlation between gender, age, and drug-related deaths. Another value could be 'Sex and race', which might indicate the relationship between drug overdose deaths and different racial backgrounds. Similarly, 'Age' could provide information about the age groups most affected by such fatalities.This endpoint is helpful when you want to explore the dataset's various dimensions or when you need to filter and analyze specific subsets of data based on different categories. The 'stubName' endpoint presents an organized way to access this information, enabling users to gain a better understanding of drug overdose deaths from different perspectives.

api_list.name: /unitNum
api_list.description: The 'unitNum' endpoint from the 'DrugOverdoseDeath' API provides a list of strings that represent the unit numbers associated with drug overdose deaths. A unit number is a unique identifier assigned to each incident or case related to drug overdose deaths. When you make a request to this endpoint, you will receive an array of strings containing various unit numbers. These unit numbers can be used to categorize and differentiate different drug overdose death cases. For instance, if you request the 'unitNum' endpoint, you might receive unit numbers like 'A1234', 'B5678', 'C9012', and so on. These values allow you to identify and track individual incidents, providing a means for data analysis and evaluation related to drug overdose deaths.

api_list.name: /stubLabelNum
api_list.description: The endpoint 'stubLabelNum' from the API 'DrugOverdoseDeath' provides a list of possible values for the field 'stubLabelNum' in a user-friendly way. This field represents a numeric label or identifier for specific data related to drug overdose deaths. The returned array contains strings representing these numeric labels. Each value in the array corresponds to a different category, subcategory, or specific data point related to drug overdose deaths. These labels enable easy categorization and identification of various aspects of drug-related deaths, providing valuable insights for analysis and understanding. The specific values within the array may vary but will always be strings representing the numeric labels assigned to different attributes or segments of drug overdose death data. This endpoint facilitates efficient data manipulation and retrieval by conveniently providing an exhaustive list of possible 'stubLabelNum' values.

api_list.name: /unit
api_list.description: The 'unit' endpoint of the DrugOverdoseDeath API provides a comprehensive list of different units that can be used to quantify the statistics related to drug overdose deaths. This endpoint returns an array of strings representing various measurement units for analyzing drug overdose-related data. Measurement units play a crucial role in accurately interpreting and comparing overdose death statistics. Different units allow for evaluating the impact of drug overdoses on population health from various perspectives. For instance, this endpoint may include units like 'Deaths per 100,000 resident population', which represents the number of deaths caused by drug overdose per 100,000 individuals living in a particular area. Other units might include 'crude Deaths per 100,000 resident population', which represents the raw count of overdose deaths excluding age adjustments. By utilizing this endpoint, users can explore and select the most suitable unit of measurement based on their specific analysis requirements. Understanding the unit options available allows for a more nuanced interpretation of drug overdose death data and supports informed decision-making in public health efforts and policy development.

api_list.name: /age
api_list.description: The 'age' endpoint in the DrugOverdoseDeath API provides a comprehensive list of age groups associated with drug overdose deaths. This endpoint helps to categorize and understand the age distribution of individuals affected by drug overdoses. The endpoint returns an array of strings representing different age ranges.By examining this endpoint, users can identify the various age groups affected by drug overdose, which can aid in analyzing trends, developing targeted prevention measures, and improving healthcare strategies.The age ranges provided by this endpoint are diverse, covering a wide spectrum. It encompasses age categories such as '0-17 years,' '18-24 years,' '25-34 years,' '35-44 years,' '45-54 years,' '55-64 years,' '65-74 years,' '75-84 years,' and '85 years and over.' Each age range represents a significant section of the population vulnerable to drug overdoses.The 'age' endpoint helps stakeholders, researchers, policymakers, and healthcare professionals gain insights into the demographics surrounding drug overdose deaths, enabling them to devise targeted interventions and allocate resources effectively. Understanding the age distribution of affected individuals is crucial for mitigating the impact of drug overdoses and working towards a healthier and safer society.

api_list.name: /stubLabel
api_list.description: The 'stubLabel' endpoint from the 'DrugOverdoseDeath' API provides a user-friendly array of possible values for a specific field called 'stubLabel'. This field represents different demographic information related to drug overdose deaths. It returns a list of strings that depict various characteristics of the deceased individuals.These values help in identifying and categorizing the affected population. The 'stubLabel' endpoint offers insights into different attributes such as gender, age range, and race. For instance, it may indicate an individual's gender as female or male, along with their corresponding age brackets. The endpoint may also include racial information, specifying if the person is White, Asian, African American, or from another racial background.By accessing the 'stubLabel' endpoint, users can better analyze and understand patterns related to drug overdose deaths. It enables researchers, health professionals, and analysts to gather comprehensive information to assess the impact of drug overdoses across specific demographics.

api_list.name: /panel
api_list.description: The 'panel' endpoint in the DrugOverdoseDeath API provides a collection of strings that represent various categories or classifications related to drug overdose deaths. Each string represents a specific type or group of cases related to drug overdose deaths. For instance, one of the possible values could be 'Drug overdose deaths involving heroin.' This indicates that the deaths mentioned in this category involve the consumption or influence of heroin. Another example value could be 'All drug overdose deaths,' which encompasses all cases of drug overdose deaths regardless of the specific substances involved. Additionally, another value might be 'Drug overdose deaths involving natural and semisynthetic opioids,' highlighting deaths associated with opioids derived from natural sources as well as partially synthetic opioids. The 'panel' endpoint offers insight into different categories or classifications related to drug overdose deaths by providing a range of descriptive strings that allow for better analysis and understanding of the data.

api_list.name: /stubNameNum

When you make a request to this endpoint, you will receive an array of strings containing all the possible values for the 'stubNameNum' field. By understanding the values of 'stubNameNum', users can gain insights into patterns, trends, and characteristics related to drug overdose deaths within the dataset provided by the API.

api_list.name: /dataListIndex
api_list.description: The 'dataListIndex' endpoint from the 'DrugOverdoseDeath' API provides an array of strings that represent possible values for the field 'dataListIndex'. This endpoint is useful for obtaining a comprehensive list of different indexes related to drug overdose death data. The 'dataListIndex' field is an identifier that helps categorize and organize information within the API. It could represent various aspects such as different types of drugs, specific demographics, locations, or time frames. Each string in the array corresponds to a unique dataListIndex value and could be used to filter or narrow down the overdose death data.For example, dataListIndex values could include identifiers such as '5911', '61', or '2499', but many more options will be available. These values have specific meanings within the context of the API and can be utilized to access and analyze the corresponding drug overdose death information.By utilizing the 'dataListIndex' endpoint, developers and researchers can explore and understand the available dataListIndex options, enabling them to retrieve more targeted data and gain insights into drug overdose deaths from various perspectives.

api_list.name: /flag
api_list.description: The 'flag' endpoint in the DrugOverdoseDeath API provides an array of strings that represent different flags associated with drug overdose deaths. These flags indicate certain characteristics or conditions related to the deaths. The endpoint returns a list of possible values for the 'flag' field, which can help in categorizing or identifying specific cases.By querying this endpoint, you can obtain valuable information about the flags recorded for drug overdose deaths. Each string in the array corresponds to a unique flag that may be assigned to a death record. These flags might be used to indicate factors such as the involvement of multiple drugs, specific abused substances, or a certain age group affected by the overdose.Utilizing this endpoint can assist in analyzing the various attributes or attributes associated with drug-related deaths.
